title: Add static logo image next to app title in AppShell header

requirements.summary: Place the provided logo in the AppShell header next to the “Make Some Double!!” title with correct alignment, spacing, and without displacing right-side controls.
acceptanceCriteria: Header shows a logo image to the left of the “Make Some Double!!” title text.
Logo and title are grouped together on the left side of the header; existing right-side controls remain on the right and remain visible.
Logo is visually aligned (vertically centered) with the title and has consistent spacing between logo and title.
Logo has appropriate accessibility attributes (e.g., non-empty alt text in English such as "Make Some Double" or "App logo").
No changes are made to any immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.

file_operations.description: Update the header layout to wrap the logo and title in a left-side flex group (logo + title), ensuring vertical centering, consistent gap, and that the right-side control cluster remains visible and right-aligned on tablet widths. Add an accessible with non-empty English alt text.

requirements.summary: Add the provided logo image as a static generated asset and reference it from the header logo element.
acceptanceCriteria: A logo file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated and is used by the header logo (or equivalent) via a static path.
The app renders the logo correctly after a full hard refresh (asset served as part of the frontend build).

file_operations.description: Add the generated logo asset file (app-logo.dim_256x256.png) as a static frontend asset to be served with the frontend build.

Reference the static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/app-logo.dim_256x256.png from the header logo and size it appropriately for the existing header so it does not push the top-right controls off-screen.
